p: The data showed a non-efficient translocation of metals between organs (TF < 1). Mentha piperita was classified as an excluder plant for all tested metals (Cd, Ni, Pb) (TC < 1) according to the principles of classification of medicinal plants as hyper-accumulators or excluders [ 41]. Prasad et al. showed that Mentha arvenis, Mentha piperita, and Mentha citrate are not hyper-accumulators for Cr and Pb [ 67]. Our results confirmed that Mentha piperita acts as a metal phytostabilizer [ 67, 68, 69].
